Authors:
Leticia Montoya, Victor M Bandala, Ingeborg Haug, Dirk
Stubbe
Title:
A new species of Lactarius (Subgenus Gerardii) from two
relict Fagus grandifolia var. mexicana populations in Mexican montane
cloud forests
Keywords:
Ectomycorrhizal fungi, neotropical fungi, Russulales,
Russulaceae, taxonomy
Abstract:
A new milkcap species, Lactarius fuscomarginatus, was
found in the subtropical region of Central Veracruz (eastern Mexico)
associated with two relict populations of Fagus grandifolia var.
mexicana. The species is macroscopically characterized by its dark
pileus and stipe and by its distant and whitish lamellae with blackish
to blackish-brown edges. A molecular phylogenetic analyses based on ITS
and LSU nucDNA sequences confirms the delimitation of this new taxon and
places L. fuscomarginatus in subgenus Gerardii (A.H. Sm. & Hesler)
Stubbe. A detailed morphological comparison is given with closely
resembling species.
